name: df-lvols
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2
body: |- wceq(clvol, cmpt(s0, universe, crab(s1, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, cfv(clpl, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s2), cfv(ccvr, cv(s0)), cv(s1))))))
bodyPretty: ⊢ LVols =(s0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ { s1 ∈(Base ` s0)| ∃(s2 ∈(LPlanes ` s0), s2[(<o ` s0)]s1)})
comment: Define the set of all 3-dimensional "lattice volumes" (lattice elements which cover a plane) in a Hilbert lattice ` k ` , in other words all elements of height 4 (or lattice dimension 4 or projective dimension 3). (Contributed by NM, 1-Jul-2012.)
